page.title: 11E.WORLINGTON POST OFFICE
page.content: The Post Office has a thatched roof and it is over 400 years old.It used to be just a shop but the old post office closed down and moved into the shop about 20 years ago.The whole building is under alarm because of burglars.The post comes before school and there are collections at 9a.m. and 3p.m. Mr and Mrs. Corley who own the Post Office at the moment have only been living there for eight months.Every fortnight they order things to sell from the shop.They open at 9.00 until 1.00 then 2.00 until 5.30. On Thursday and Saturday they only open in the morning.Mr. and Mrs. Corley not only run the Post Office but they sometimes take people to places if there is no transport and they also book for the Parish Hall and put up posters for the public.
